meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characterized by an exanthem.
meanings.sent1: The exanthematic rash covered the child's entire body.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with an exanthematic skin condition.
meanings.sent3: The exanthematic spots on the puppy made it look like a polka-dotted toy.
meanings.sent4: The exanthematic outbreak spread through the school like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The exanthematic nature of the disease made it easily identifiable.

meanings.definition: Having or relating to an exanthem.
meanings.sent1: Her exanthematic symptoms included fever and a rash.
meanings.sent2: The exanthematic reaction was a side effect of the medication.
meanings.sent3: The exanthematic appearance of the flower petals surprised the gardener.
meanings.sent4: The exanthematic reaction to the allergen was immediate and severe.
meanings.sent5: The exanthematic nature of the virus made it highly contagious.

meanings.definition: Causing or resulting in an exanthem.
meanings.sent1: The exanthematic virus quickly spread throughout the community.
meanings.sent2: The exanthematic reaction was a common response to the vaccine.
meanings.sent3: The exanthematic outbreak at the zoo led to the closure of the park.
meanings.sent4: The exanthematic effect of the medication was unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The exanthematic nature of the illness was concerning to health officials.
